Age 3: Points to nose, eyes and mouth
Age 5: Compares two weights (Provide 2 objects of different weight)
Age 6: Distinguishes between morning and afternoon. (ask what it is right now)
Age 7: Shows right hand and left ear
Age 10: Arranges five blocks in order of weight. (any 5 objects)

Age 4: Names key, knife and rupees (Any 3 familiar objects)
Age 6: Define words in terms of use (ex. What is a spoon?)

Age 3: Enumerates objects in a picture (at least 3)
Age 5: Repeats a sentence of ten syllables. (His name is Jack.Oh what a naughty boy.)
Age 9: Recognises all the pieces of money.
Age 10: Names the months of the year, in order

Age 7: Add 3 ‘1 rupee’ coins and 3 ‘5 rupee’ coins

Age 3: Repeats a sentence of six syllables. (It rains. I am hungry)
Age 5: Unites the halves of a divided rectangle.
Age 6: Distinguishes pictures of ugly and pretty faces.
Age 9: Answers or Comprehends “Easy Questions” (How old are you?)
